label: 三綱
本: The Emergence of Japanese Kingship . Stanford University Press . 1997
説明文: literally, the three deans-jōza, jishu, and tsuina-who administered a monastic community. By the eighth century their appointments were confirmed by orders of the Council of State, but names of potential appointees are thought to have been proposed by the monastic community. [上座、寺主、都維那]
